page.title: 18An old resident.
page.content: We visited an old inhabitant of Braceborough of 84.He was born in his house in 1901.He has a window in the end of his house which came from an old cathedral.He said he enjoyed farming.He was one of 10 children and he has 2.He used to go to the school in Braceborough village hall until he was 13 then he had to walk to school at Greatford 4 times a day.His family used to have 4 Shire horses who used to pull the plough.He has been a church warden for over 50 years.His father had a pony and trap. There used to be Braceborough Hall,a Manor Farm,a blacksmith,a game keepers cottage and a coach house and stables,and a rectory.People used to come a nd drink the spa water.George 111 may have come as he was being treated by the Willis brothers who were doctors in Harley St. and who lived in the Hall.
